subdefinitions.definition: The act of reserving or keeping back; reservation ; exception .
examples: I accept your view with one reserve .

subdefinitions.definition: Restraint of freedom in words or actions; backwardness ; caution in personal behavior.

definitions.definition: That which is reserved or kept back, as for future use.

subdefinitions.definition: A natural resource known to exist but not currently exploited.
examples: New oil reserves are continuously being discovered, but not as fast as the existing ones are running out.

subdefinitions.definition: A tract of land reserved, or set apart, for a particular purpose
examples: the Connecticut Reserve in Ohio was originally set apart for the school fund of Connecticut.
the Clergy Reserves in Canada are for the support of the clergy.

subdefinitions.definition: A tract of land set apart for the use of an Aboriginal group : Indian reserve.
A body of troops kept in the rear of an army drawn up for battle, reserved to support the other lines as occasion may require; a force or body of troops kept for an exigency .
Funds kept on hand to meet planned or unplanned financial requirements.
A reserve price in an auction .
Wine held back and aged before being sold.
Absence of color or decoration; the state of being left plain .

definitions.definition: Something initially kept back for later use in recreation .

subdefinitions.definition: A member of a team who does not participate from the start of the game, but can be used to replace tired or injured team-mates.
A group or pile of cards dealt out at the beginning of a patience or solitaire game to be used during play.

definitions.definition: In exhibitions , a distinction indicating that the recipient will get a prize in the event of another person being disqualified.
A preparation used on an object being electroplated to fix the limits of the deposit .

secondary_definitions: That which is reserved or kept back, as for future use.
Something initially kept back for later use in recreation .
In exhibitions , a distinction indicating that the recipient will get a prize in the event of another person being disqualified.
A preparation used on an object being electroplated to fix the limits of the deposit .
